storyInfo: Narantuya finds a golden lamp that marks the location of treasure. It takes great effort and more than a little money for her to reach the destination, but things turn out quite different from what she expected.

attributes.content: 'Pfft! Bleh! Ugh!'
'Who dug this hole in the road? I almost broke my back, and my mouth's full of sand!'
The red-headed Kuranta climbs out of the sand hole, looking quite the worse for wear. She is wearing a burdenbeast skull on her foot, having stepped right through the top of it.
She turns around to yell at the empty desert, hardly bothering to even pat the dust and sand off herself.
She does not even know whom she is yelling at, but the more she thinks about it, the angrier she gets. She pulls the skull off her foot and throws it far away.
Which caravan didn't even bother to look for a burdenbeast that fell into a hole? Those bones almost went through my thigh!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: And why were they carrying a whole bunch of linen instead of something worth money? *Sargon expletive* All that trouble, and I come back nearly empty-handed!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya lifts the object she has been holding. It was the only thing that shined gold in the hole, so she took it with her on her way out.
She peruses her lone souvenir in the bright sunlight.
The elaborate patterns on the golden lamp glow brightly.
It's made of gold? Should be worth a pretty good sum! Guess it was a blessing in disguise!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya wipes the lamp on her clothes, and it casts its golden reflection upon her face.
Wait, are those words engraved on it?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: 'To Asaf of Fountain Town. Happy eighth birthday. Love, Mother.'
'Treasure it, for it will illuminate all the treasures I left for you.'
...Damned rich people. They give their kids presents made of solid gold?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Well, I guess it'll be justice for all the poor folks they've been stepping on when I turn this golden lamp into meat and wine for my stomach at the bazaar!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya takes a few steps, then stops. She looks down again at the engraved words.
'Treasures'. I read that right, didn't I? It says 'treasures'?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Treasures left behind by such wealthy people...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: They must be worth even more than this golden lamp!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Hey, old man! Show your face! I've got questions for you!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What's the rush? Have a couple of drinks to cool down.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: You've been to more places in this desert than I have. Have you heard of a 'Fountain Town'?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Of course! Fountain Town is... hehe.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Spit it out!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What is this? Vengeance, or robbery?
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: ...It's a wealthy place, isn't it? Tell me where it is.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: No rush, no rush, have a couple of drinks with me and I'll tell you.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: ...Fine, I was thirsty anyway.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Why are you only pouring one? Aren't you drinking?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Sure am. This one's mine.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: What about mine?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Gotta pay up first.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Like I ever owed you booze money. How much?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: One hundred... no, two hundred dinars.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Narantuya's hand, which was reaching for the coin bag on her belt, freezes in mid-air. With clenched teeth, she asks—
You think your diluted arak is worth two hundred dinars a cup?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: But the information you're looking for is.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: It's none of my business what business you have at Fountain Town, whether you were hired to bump somebody off, or found a treasure map for a pot of gold...
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Two hundred dinars, then? Fine, I'll pay. Bring the booze!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Guessed right, didn't I? Hey, no need to glare. You think this bundle of old bones is gonna steal your treasure?
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Bah, paying two hundred dinars doesn't make your swill taste any better!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: One cup's not enough to loosen your lips? Fine, I'll have another!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya throws her whole coin bag at the man. It is unclear whether she is grimacing because the alcohol is burning her throat, or the frustration is burning her heart.
What are you sitting there for? Pour! There's gotta be at least two hundred dinars in the bag!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Two hundred was for the first cup. The second's gonna cost you four hundred.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Now, now, don't get violent with me, Narantuya. I know you're good, but every bazaar has its rules, and my rule is...
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: No refunds.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: If one cup's enough for you, that's fine too. So many sand bandits are looking to make their fortune in this desert, someone's gotta be willing to buy a couple of cups.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: I'll be back in half an hour with the money... And you better not tell anyone.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya touches the scimitar on her belt and puts on her fiercest expression.
Sure, sure...
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Thump.
The sound of the heavy coin bag hitting the counter wakes the fake liquor seller with such a fright that he falls to the ground.
Narantuya grabs the bottle from behind the counter and takes a swig from it.
What are you doing? Count them.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Y-You've gotta have at least a thousand dinars in this bag! Don't tell me...
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: No need to get excited. I just sold a burdenbeast to a caravan.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Since when did you have a burdenbeast?
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Since just now. Stole it from a passing caravan.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't tell me it was the same caravan.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: It was the same caravan.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Did those idiots not realize?
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Nope. Wanna know how it went down?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Then tell me where this *Sargon expletive* Fountain Town is!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Alright, alright, no rush, lemme pour you a cup—from my special collection. Not diluted at all.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Narantuya downs the spirit and looks at the 'map' the fake liquor seller gave her.
Little more than a napkin with a few lines drawn on it, representing hills and roads.
It's at least a three or four day journey... are you sure?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: When have I ever scammed anyone... I mean, when have I ever scammed you?
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: But you're right, it's a long way. Way too long to walk.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Are you trying to sell me your old and deaf burdenbeast? The one you have tied up behind the tent?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You catch on quick! I'll give you a good price, eight hundred dinars!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: It's hauled goods for you your entire life without getting a single decent meal, and now you want to sell it to me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Well, if you won't buy it, I guess I'm having meat for dinner.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Narantuya shakes her head.
...What I mean is, you're selling it short. I think it's worth a thousand dinars, at least.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya takes the 'map', downs the rest of the cup's contents, and turns around to leave.
Hey, Narantuya! You didn't tell me how the caravan didn't notice that you stole their burdenbeast!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: ...I just dangled some wheat in front of its face, and it came with me quietly.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: That's all? How boring.
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Serves them right for all the dirty business they do, though!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Serves 'em right... Yeah. Absolutely.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The moment Narantuya leaves, the fake liquor seller starts quickly packing up his tent.
Closing shop so early?
attributes.name: Drunken Passerby

attributes.content: Yeah, come back tomorrow... No, I won't be here tomorrow. Hope we meet again!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: What, you owe someone money?
attributes.name: Drunken Passerby

attributes.content: Just scammed a madwoman. Gotta get out of town before she comes back... Now stop asking questions and scram!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: The fake liquor seller runs out the tent with his luggage on his back, only to realize that there is only a rope tied to the stake where he leashed his burdenbeast.
*Sargon expletive*! Narantuya! So it was MY burdenbeast that you stole!
attributes.name: Fake Liquor Seller

attributes.content: Damn, spent all my money before I even caught a glimpse of the treasure.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't disappoint me, sweet treasure... *hic*... it better be all gold coins inside a chest made of solid gold!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya climbs to the top of the hill and compares the map with the view in front of her.
Shouldn't there be a hill here?
attributes.name: Narantuya
Narantuya
attributes.content: Was I holding it upside down?

attributes.name: Narantuya
attributes.content: Oh! Now I see a village. That's more like it.
Narantuya rubs her eyes and casts her gaze forward, but her vision remains blurred.
That drink made me even more thirsty. Gotta find a place with a well to spend the night. Hopefully a burdenbeast to carry me too...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya stands up with unsteady legs.
Damn, how could this stuff be so strong?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya takes a few wobbly steps forward and steps into a musbeast hole, causing her to fall and roll down the slopes.
Ow! My head!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'm never drinking fake liquor again!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...My head hurts!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Where am I... why does it feel so wet... is it raining?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya opens her eyes and sees a familiar burdenbeast licking her face excitedly.
What's going on?!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I found the burdenbeast! Hey, aren't you that girl who sold it to me?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader
Narantuya
attributes.content: What happened to me...

attributes.name: Narantuya
attributes.content: Oh no, the map!
Narantuya frantically searches herself and is relieved to find that the creased map is still there.
Phew... you didn't touch my stuff, did you?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We just arrived, following the burdenbeast's tracks. Did you fall from the hill? Look at all the bruises on you...
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: You're not thinking of buying it back, are you? It'll cost you at least three thousand dinars.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader
Narantuya
attributes.content: No, I'm not...

attributes.name: Narantuya
attributes.content: Wait, that's double the price, isn't it?
We're counting on this old burdenbeast to find water for us! Well, it found you first.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Maybe it just smelled a familiar liquor... Are you guys heading this way too?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Are you passing by Fountain Town? The place marked on this map...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...You call this a 'map'?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: I bought it with the money I sold the burdenbeast for. Maybe I'm holding it upside down. This is the place where Fountain Town should be...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Hah, you got scammed, lady. This is just a bunch of scribbles!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: I got scammed?!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Now I remember. Fountain Town was a really wealthy place.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: But it fell on hard times a few decades ago, and everyone moved away. There's only a Fountain Village now, which happens to be in the same direction we're headed.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: (But the golden lamp said 'Fountain Town'. Are people just used to the old name?)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: If it's the same direction, can you take me along on the way? I'll pay you once we get there.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We don't do credit. Small business.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Then... how about I guard your caravan? You won't need to pay me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You see those thirty big, burly, armed men over there? They're our guards.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: I can feed your burdenbeasts?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We have dedicated keepers that work around the clock in shifts.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: What DO you need then?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Hm... we could use someone to collect the burdenbeast dung behind us. It's useful as fuel. But you'll have to walk behind the caravan all day. Not the sort of work most people are willing to do.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: ...I'll do it!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (I'll just pick a strong and healthy burdenbeast and run away with it when we're near the place!)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (He wanted to sell it back for twice the price! That's highway robbery! Someone should teach you a lesson!)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Hey, thanks. Must be hard work, eating sand and dust all day in the rear.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: There's more than just sand... What the hell are you feeding these burdenbeasts?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You got any water? I want to wash my face and hands.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You know how precious water is in the desert. Bear with it.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: I'm just here to collect what you picked up today... Wait, you filled this whole cart with the stuff?!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: ...I just want to know when we get to Fountain Village.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We're almost there.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Are we there yet?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Almost—
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Are the there yet?!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Almost, really!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: We're not there yet... Oh, screw this. Call over your thirty guards.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What for?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Because next time you say 'almost', I'm putting my fist in your face. But I need your guards there so you can't say I'm bullying you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We'll be there soon! Trust me!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Look, right over there! You see those dozen houses on the bank of the river? We've been going around it, but this time we're really almost there!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Going around it? What d'you mean?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We're running a business here! All the caravans go around that poor, backwater place.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: (Poor, backwater place? If you knew there was treasure there...)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So you never intended to take me to Fountain Village?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Our deal was just to take you along on the way.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: 'Take me along'? You had me shoveling dung behind the caravan!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'd beat you to a pulp if I wasn't so tired... Fine, I'll go there myself! You can pick up this stuff yourself!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't throw it at me!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Now my silk tunic's all dirty! I'm deducting this from your pay!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: You're not paying me anything!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't care. Any damage is to be paid back at three times the original price. Right now, you owe me 2700 dinars, plus a ten percent handling fee if you pay in gold certificates.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: ...I don't have any money on me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I can loan you some. The interest-rate per day is...
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: What's that sound... why are you grinding your teeth like that?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Now, now, no need to get violent. You have something pretty valuable on your belt, don't you?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Narantuya looks down at her belt. The golden lamp, which she had wrapped in a tattered piece of cloth. The handle has become exposed, and its golden glow shines brightly.
...Not this.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...I have thirty guards.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: And I have four blades. You're welcome to try.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Come on! You're being as unreasonable as a sand bandit! We've done business before, haven't we?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Unreasonable? I... I AM a sand bandit!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Well, even sand bandits have to buy food and sell their stolen wares. I can at least give you a price for your trinket. You might even end up selling it to me anyway.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Narantuya angrily takes out the lamp and presses it against the caravan leader's nose.
You think I care about your money? You see this? Made of solid gold! It's enough to buy all your burdenbeasts with change to spare!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Solid gold? Doesn't look that way to me.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: The caravan leader scratches the side of the golden lamp lightly with his fingernail, revealing the dull color underneath.
See? It's copper on the inside with a layer of golden paint... Hah, got scammed by someone else, didn't you?
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Though it's good craftsmanship, I'll give it that. Might have fooled me, if I were a little less knowledgeable.
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: But if I knew you were this gullible, I'd have struck a harder bargain when I bought your burdenbeast... haha....
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Every word from the caravan leader makes Narantuya's expression grow darker. She clutches the 'golden' lamp so hard it is almost as if she is trying to crush it.
She looks up at the caravan leader, whose mouth continues to move, babbling words that she is not listening to. All she knows that they irritate her.
She raises her fist.
Y-You hit me! Guards! Where are my thirty guards? Help!
attributes.name: Caravan Leader

attributes.content: Narantuya is tired, thirsty, hungry, and angry.
She reaches towards her belt and finds her empty coin bag. She is also poor.
Then, she finds the lamp, and she angrily tosses it towards the sky.
*Sargon expletive*!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This is all your fault!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The lamp spins in the air a few times, then falls straight back down, almost hitting her in the face.
It falls on the sand, the engraved side facing up. Narantuya remembers the words without having to look.

attributes.text: '...it will illuminate all the treasures I left for you.'

attributes.content: ...Some damned treasure.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya drags her exhausted hide forward. She is not sure where she is going, as long as it is away from the lamp.
But then, she recalls the other line etched on it—

attributes.text: 'To Asaf of Fountain Town. Happy eighth birthday. Love, Mother.'

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya angrily kicks the sand and hits a hard rock. It hurts so much it brings tears to her eyes.
She slows down and eventually turns around to pick up the lamp.
Never give up, even if it's just a tiny sliver of hope... For the treasure...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't let me down this time.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This is Fountain Town... I mean, Fountain Village, right?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Who are you looking for?
attributes.name: Wary Villager

attributes.content: Does someone by the name of Asaf live here?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What do you want with him? I've never seen you around these parts!
attributes.name: Wary Villager

attributes.content: It's a long story. Bring him over—I have something to give him.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Is someone looking for old Asaf? He's really sick. The mayor said no one is to go near his house.
attributes.name: Worried Villager

attributes.content: Old Asaf?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: There must be a mistake. The Asaf I'm looking for is eight years old.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: There's only ever been one Asaf in Fountain Village, and he's a hundred and one.
attributes.name: Wary Villager

attributes.content: He might've even broken our age record, if his children hadn't moved away and refused to take care of him...
attributes.name: Worried Villager

attributes.content: There's no one taking care of him?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What's it to you? I'm still not letting you in our village!
attributes.name: Wary Villager

attributes.content: With a sigh, Narantuya takes out the golden lamp, carefully placing her thumb to hide where the paint was scratched off.
Let me see him. You can have this, if he's really the one I'm looking for.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The villagers look at the golden object, then at each other hesitantly.
Narantuya walks into the tiny hut. The air is filled with dust and the strong smell of herbs.
A withered old man lies on the bed, his chest heaving up and down, and a strange rattle coming from his throat.
Narantuya can see his life fading before her eyes.
Wait! Don't... not yet!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya dashes towards the bed and puts the slightly misshapen lamp in the old man's hand.
Holding his withered hand, she lifts the lamp into the sunlight, and it reflects its golden glow in the old man's eyes.
Look, there are words etched here! Let me read them for you—
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: 'To Asaf of Fountain Town. Happy eighth birthday. Love, Mother.'
You're Asaf, right? This was a birthday present from your mom, but an accident happened and it never reached you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Do you hear me, Asaf? I'm giving you the golden lamp that your mom gave you as a present!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The old man's eyes go wide and his lips quiver, but no coherent words come out of them.
Yes, your mom. You remember her, right?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Do you remember where this 'treasure' she talked about is?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Trea—sure. Treasure!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I didn't catch that. Say it again?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya leans down, putting her ears towards the old man's mouth, only to feel that his hands seem to have regained a little bit of strength.
He clutches the golden lamp and presses it against his chest, above his heart.
Then, he slowly reaches out towards the single ray of sunlight shining through the roof.
'To Asaf of Fountain Town...'
'...it will illuminate all the treasures I left for you.'
The sun shines upon the old man's palm and face. Narantuya does not know what he saw in the sunlight, but she sees a content smile on his face.
The old man closes his eyes and mutters softly...
...I see it, Mother.
attributes.name: Dying Old Man

attributes.content: So where's the treasure?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The old man opens his eyes irritably, and Narantuya could swear that he rolled his eyes at her.
He opens his lips again, and Narantuya leans forward—
She's the one who insisted on seeing Asaf, mayor!
attributes.name: Wary Villager

attributes.content: She had gold on her! Said she would give it to us!
attributes.name: Worried Villager

attributes.content: Narantuya does not answer. She draws her knife and plunges it in the ground.
Have you prepared a grave for him?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya picks a withered tree and buries the old man under it, along with the lamp.
Sorry it's so far away. They won't let me bury you in the village. Wasn't easy, carrying you all the way here.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This hilltop overlooks Fountain Village, so you'll always be able to see it if you miss home.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: And the tree'll give you shade, so that the sand won't burn your back.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...It'll also tell me where you are, if I ever come through here again.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya leans against the tree and wiggles her hands, which had become numb from the exertion.
All that effort and not a single coin to show for it. Never thought I'd have to bury someone I've never met before.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So the treasure I was looking for was just a mother's blessings for her child...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'd already thrown the lamp away and was totally ready to leave, but then I thought about that little boy sitting by the door, waiting for his birthday present...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Who knew he'd been waiting that long?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya pats the withered tree, and a hollow sound comes out of it.
Well, that was a total loss. I'm never doing this again.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya sighs and stands up. In one last act of frustration, she punches the withered tree.
Crack—
It seems she punched it a little too hard. A long crack appears in the trunk, revealing the hollow within.
...Please don't be dried burdenbeast dung.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya stretches her hand into the hollow, and finds a heavy and strangely-shaped object.
...You've got to be kidding me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: It is a goblet etched with elaborate patterns, with gems embedded across its surface. The form and craftsmanship are on a completely different level from the lamp she just buried.
Oh please—
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya lifts it before her eyes, and it shines bright gold under the setting sun.
What the hell is going on?!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya examines the golden goblet carefully.
In the last light of dusk, she seems to see some delicate etchings on the bottom, looking strangely like...
No!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya closes her eyes and lies down on the sand, still clutching the goblet.
Not now... I'm too tired for this right now...
attributes.name: Narantuya
